profileText: A Representative from New York; born in the town of Maryland, Otsego County, N.Y., birth date unknown; attended the common schools; engaged in agricultural pursuits; also engaged in mercantile and milling pursuits at Schenevus, Otsego County, N.Y.; elected as a Whig to the Thirty-third Congress (March 4, 1853-March 3, 1855); resumed his former agricultural and business pursuits; died in Chaseville, Maryland Township, N.Y., April 17, 1867; interment in the Chase vault in Schenevus Cemetery, Schenevus, N.Y.
